This would indicate that a perspective descriptor is returning null for its 
image descriptor. I cannot reproduce the problem on a "generic" M2. 
Likely the result of a "bad" perspective definition. Needs investigation.

Created an attachment (id=14803)
Screenshot of the View Management dialog

Created an attachment (id=14804)
Screenshot of the Select Perspective dialog

I think it's the Java Spider perspective. If you select Window > Open
Perspective > Other and compare this dialog to the previous one, you can see
Spider is missing from the previous one.

BTW, why is the order totally different in the two dialogs?

The schema for org.eclipse.ui.perspectives defines the image attribute as optional, but 
IPerspectiveDescriptor#getImageDescriptor() does not say that it can return null.

Either these two APIs should be made consistent or the implementation of PerspectiveDescriptor 
should return a default image instead of null to fulfill its current API.
Note that Debug's workaround for this problem is tracked in Bug 75123.
*** This bug has been marked as a duplicate of 68325 ***
